Package org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.helperClasses.bezierCurves

Class Vector

java.lang.Object
org.firstinspires.ftc.teamcode.helperClasses.bezierCurves.Vector
public class Vector extends Object
This is the Vector class. This class handles storing information about vectors, which are basically Points but using polar coordinates as the default. The main reason this class exists is because some vector math needs to be done in the Follower, and dot products and cross products of Points just don't seem right. Also, there are a few more methods in here that make using Vectors a little easier than using a Point in polar coordinates.

    • setComponents

      public void setComponents(double magnitude, double theta)
      Sets the vector's magnitude and direction (polar coordinates). Updates the Cartesian components accordingly.
      Parameters:
      magnitude - the magnitude to set
      theta - the direction (angle in radians) to set

      yComponent - the y component to set

    • times

      public Vector times(double scalar)
      This multiplies the current Vector by a scalar and returns the result as a Vector.
      Parameters:
      scalar - the scalar multiplying into the Vector.
      Returns:
      returns the scaled Vector.

    • normalize

      public Vector normalize()
      This normalizes this Vector to be of magnitude 1, unless this Vector is the zero Vector. In that case, it just returns back the zero Vector but with a different memory location.
      Returns:
      returns the normalized (or zero) Vector.

    • plus

      public Vector plus(Vector other)
      This returns a Vector that is the sum of the this vector and the other input Vector.
      Parameters:
      other - the other Vector.
      Returns:
      returns the sum of the Vectors.

    • minus

      public Vector minus(Vector other)
      This subtracts the other Vector from the current Vector and returns the result as a Vector. Do note that order matters here.
      Parameters:
      other - the other Vector.
      Returns:
      returns the second Vector subtracted from the first Vector.

    • dot

      public double dot(Vector other)
      This computes the dot product of the current Vector and the other Vector.
      Parameters:
      other - the Other Vector.
      Returns:
      returns the dot product of the two Vectors.

    • cross

      public double cross(Vector other)
      This computes the current Vector crossed with the other Vector, so a cross product. Do note that order matters here.
      Parameters:
      other - the other Vector.
      Returns:
      returns the cross product of the two Vectors.

    • linearCombination

      public Vector linearCombination(Vector other, double scaleThis, double scaleOther)
      This returns a Vector that is the linear combination of the current vector and another vector.
      Parameters:
      other - the other vector
      scaleThis - the coefficient for the current vector
      scaleOther - the second coefficient for the other vector
      Returns:
      the resulting vector
